title: How Many Calories in Steak?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in steak per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition facts for lean cuts.
assumptions: Lean sirloin steak, trimmed of visible fat, cooked by broiling without added oil or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of lean cooked steak provides ~206 kcal and ~30 g protein.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 206 kcal for lean sirloin, cooked.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in steak?
faqs.a: Broiling or grilling keeps calories lower; frying adds fat and calories.

faqs.q: What about fat content in steak?
faqs.a: Lean cuts have ~9g total fat per 100g, with 3.7g saturated.
No, steak has 0g carbs, fiber, or sugars per 100g.
